column1: 37F8472F-68AA-401D-8DF7-908F1C5590E0#appfire#24A0014F-56AA-4986-9989-7AF8C47363B3#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 16:53:25.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 16:53:25.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#844836E3-B5E1-4E12-BE1A-2BFB28A9EB2F#appfire#24A0014F-56AA-4986-9989-7AF8C47363B3#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 16:53:25.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 16:53:25.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#891CA01C-CE61-42E7-AA9A-EF6C3DF138A6#appfire#24A0014F-56AA-4986-9989-7AF8C47363B3#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 16:53:25.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 16:53:25.0#appfire#1
